site_number: DEVELOPMENT SITE AT FORMER THAMES WATER LAND KEW BRIDGE ROAD
description: Variation of condition 4 (plans) to allow for conversion of the approved commercial floorspace within Buildings B and C (flexible Use Classes B1a/ B1b/ D1/ D2) comprising 308 sq.m to provide 4 no. residential apartments following planning permission 00657/B/P27 dated 26/06/2015 for Variation of condition 4 (plans) to allow for two additional storeys of residential accommodation to Building A and one additional storey of residential accommodation to Building B to provide 15 additional dwellings (Use Class C3), minor increase in the height of Building C, relocation of the substation and alterations to the balconies on the northeast corner of Building A with minor alterations to window openings on Buildings A, B and C (minor material amendments) of planning permission 00657/P21 dated 22/03/2012.
site_name: Development Site At Former Thames Water Land
decision_conditions: Condition : 1 - The development hereby permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.

Condition : 2 - The development shall be carried out in accordance with the detailed drawings of windows, external doors, balconies and privacy screens approved 07/10/2015 under application reference 00657/B/P27(2,3) (Drawings: 3323 PL01P1, PL02P1, PL03P1, PL04P1, PL05P1, PL06P1 received 21/07/2015).

Condition : 3 - The development shall be carried out in accordance with the construction samples as approved 07/10/2015 under application reference 00657/B/P27(2,3) (Sample Board ref. 3323 SB01 received 21/07/2015).

Condition : 4 - The development shall be carried out in all respects in accordance with the proposals contained in the application and the plans submitted therewith [A2190 501 P2 Received: 24 December 2014; Archaeological Desk Based Assessment To AD 1838, Code for Sustainable Homes Pre-Certification Framework Report, Desk Based Assessment, Ecological Site Walkover (letter from Greengage dated 11 December 2014), Flood Risk Assessment, Heritage Appraisal, Planning Statement, Transport Statement, Statement of Community Involvement Addendum, Sustainability update (letter from Greengage dated 11 December 2014) Received: 14 January 2015; A2190 300 P14, A2190 301 P14, A2190 302 P14, A2190 303 P14, A2190 304 P14, A2190 305 P15, A2190 306 P15, A2190 307 P15, A2190 320 P21, A2190 321 P13, A2190 322 P13, A2190 323 P9, A2190 324 P4, A2190 325 P4, A2190 330 P3, A2190 331 P3, A2190 500 P4, A2190 600 P8, A2190 601 P10, A2190 602 P10, A2190 603 P11, A2190 604 P10, A2190 605 P9, A2190 606 P8, A2190 620 P2, A2190 624 P3, A2190 625 P3 Received: 13 February 2015; Air Quality Assessment, Arboricultural Implications Report, GLA Information, Noise Assessment, TPPacsEB_KBR Rev. B Received: 03 February 2015 A2509 301 R5, A2509 302 R5, A2509 303 R5, A2509 304 R5, A2509 305 R5, A2509 306 R5, A2509 307 R5, A2509 308 R5, A2509 320 R5, A2509 321 R5, A2509 322 R5, A2509 323 R5, A2509 324 R5, A2509 325 R5, A2509 326 R5, A2509 327 R1, A2509 604 Block A Lift Provision, Daylight and Sunlight Assessment, Energy Statement Received: 02 March 2015; Accommodation Schedule Received: 03 March 2015; Design and Access Statement Addendum Received: 10 March 2015; A2509 606 R6, A2509 620 R5, Received: 12 March 2015; A2509 309 R5, A2509 603 R5 Received: 16 March 2015; A2509 300 R8, A2509 330 R6, A2509 331 R5, A2509 500 R6, A2509 501 R1, A2509 600 R7, A2509 601 R7, A2509 602 R7, A2509 605 R7, A2509 624 R6, A2509 625 R6, A2509 626 R6, Transport Statement Addendum, Noise Assessment version 3 dated 08 September 2016, Letter dated 06

Condition : 5 - The installation of air conditioning units, aerials and smoke extract/ducting shall be carried out in accordance with the details as approved 29/10/2015 under application reference 00657/B/P27(5) (Drawings: 3323 AL(20)130 Rev. P2, 3323 AL(20)125 Rev. P2, 3323 AL(20)119 Rev. P1 and 000; Air Conditioning Product Information; Aerial Array On Roof plan and specification, all received 13/07/2015).

Condition : 6 - No demolition or construction work shall take place on the site except between the hours of 8:00am to 6:00pm Mondays to Fridays, 8:00am to 1:00pm on Saturdays, with no work to take place on Sundays and Bank Holidays without the prior agreement of the Local Planning Authority.

Condition : 7 - The development shall comply in full with the contents of the submitted and approved Construction Logistics Plan and a Construction Environmental Management Plan (CEMP) unless otherwise agreed beforehand in writing by the Local Planning Authority.

Condition : 8 - The development shall be carried out in accordance with the details of measures to provide satisfactory privacy to all windows of dwellings at first floor level that face the roof of one of the two 'link buildings' as approved 05/11/2015 under application reference 00657/B/P27(8,11) (Drawings: OX4748-3-100 Rev. C02, 101 Rev. C02, 102 Rev. C02, 103 Rev. C02, 200 Rev. C02, 201 Rev. C01 and 202 Rev. C02, all received 17/09/2015).

Condition : 9 - The arrangements for storing waste and recycled materials shall not be carried out otherwise than in accordance with the approved plans, drawings and supporting information (A2509 300 R7) and shall be completed before any part of the relevant residential block of accommodation hereby permitted is occupied.

Condition : 10 - The development shall be carried out in accordance with the details to protect residents from external noise as approved 09/02/2016 under application reference 00657/B/P27(10) (Noise assessment prepared by Cass Allen, received 13/07/2015).

Condition : 11 - With the exception of the details required pursuant to condition 39, the development shall be carried out in accordance with the details of both hard and soft landscape works as approved 27/09/2016 under application reference 00657/B/P27(11i) and 05/11/2015 under application reference 00657/B/P27(8,11) (OX4748-3 500 Kew Bridge Road Phase 2 Landscape Specification Rec C01 received 17/09/2015; Drawings: OX4748-3 100 Rev. C02, 104 Rev. C02, 200 Rev. C02, 201 Rev. C01, 310-316 Rev. C01, 320 Rev. C02, 321-322 Rev. C01, 400 Rev. C01 & 401-405 Rev. C00, all received 17/09/2015; Drawings: OX4748-3 101 Rev. C04, 102-103 Rev. C03, 202 Rev. C03, 323 Rev. C02, 406 Rev. C02 & 427 Rev D00, all received 09/08/2016). Notwithstanding the details of the scheme for phased implementation, the linear park at the south of the site shall be completed in accordance with the approved details prior to occupation of 50% of the dwellings at the site.

Condition : 12 - The development shall be carried out in accordance with the Landscape Management Plan as approved 20/01/2017 under application reference 00657/B/P27(12) (OX4748-3 700 Rev C01 received 04/11/2016). The Landscape Management Plan shall be carried out as approved for the lifetime of the development.

Condition : 13 - The development shall be carried out in accordance with the details to establish a cultural precinct as approved 15/01/2016 under application reference 00657/B/P27(13) (Cultural Strategy received 14/09/2015; Site photos received 11/01/2016; Drawing No. OX478-1-001 Rev. C04 received 11/01/2016; Unnumbered Site Plan received 11/01/2016).

Condition : 14 - In this condition "retained tree" means an existing tree which is to be retained in accordance with the approved plans and particulars; and paragraphs (a) and (b) below shall have effect until the expiration of (5 years?) from (the date of the occupation of the building for its permitted use). 
(a)	No retained tree shall be cut down, uprooted or destroyed, nor shall any retained tree be topped or lopped other than in accordance with the approved plans and particulars, without the written approval of the local planning authority.  Any topping or lopping approved shall be carried out in accordance with British Standard [3998 (Tree Work)] or any other BS replacing. 
(b)	If any retained tree is removed, uprooted or destroyed or dies, another tree shall be planted at the same place and that tree shall be of such size and species, and shall be planted at such time, as may be specified in writing by the local planning authority. 
(c)	The erection of fencing for the protection of any retained tree shall be undertaken in accordance with the approved plans and particulars before any equipment, machinery or materials are brought on to the site for the purposes of the development, and shall be maintained until all equipment, machinery and surplus materials have been removed from the site.  Nothing shall be stored or placed in any area fenced in accordance with this condition and the ground levels within those areas shall not be altered, nor shall any excavation be made, without the written consent of the local planning authority.
Condition : 15 - Each residential block shall not be occupied until a means of vehicular access for each residential block has been constructed in accordance with the approved plans.

Condition : 16 - The parking, loading and turning spaces shown on the approved plans (A2590 300 R7) shall be constructed and available for use before first occupation of each residential block of development and such spaces shall not be used for any other purposes.

Condition : 17 - 10% of the approved units shall be capable of adaption to wheelchair accessible standards in accordance with the approved drawings and 'The Lifetime Homes Design Guide' by Lifetime Homes.

Condition : 18 - The development shall comply in full with the contents of the submitted and approved Energy Statement, except where it makes reference to the revoked Code for Sustainable Homes. In accordance with the Ministerial Statement dated March 2015, the proposed development shall achieve an energy performance equivalent to Code for Sustainable Homes Level 4, unless otherwise agreed beforehand in writing by the Local Planning Authority.

Condition : 19 - The development shall be carried out in accordance with the exterior lighting details as approved 20/01/2017 under reference 00657/B/P27(19) (OX4748-3 104 Rev. 1 received 07/12/2016 & email received from St James on 19/01/2017). The details shall be implemented as approved prior to the occupation of the dwellings adjacent to relevant areas.

Condition : 20 - The development shall be carried out in accordance with the delivery and servicing arrangements as approved 30/01/2017 under reference 00657/B/P27 (20,21) (Delivery and Servicing Plan by St James received 28/11/2016). The delivery and servicing arrangements shall thereafter be managed in compliance with the approved Delivery and Servicing Plan.

Condition : 21 - The development shall be carried out in accordance with the car park management details as approved 30/01/2017 (Kew Bridge West - Heritage Car Park Management Plan by Crabtree Property Management received 23/01/2017). The car parking areas shall thereafter be managed in compliance with the approved Car Park Management Plan.

Condition : 22 - Prior to the first occupation of each residential block, the cycle parking spaces shown on the approved plans that are associated with that block shall be made available for use and thereafter retained (double stackers in the cycle stores at Buildings A, B and C).  Prior to the first occupation of the last residential block to be built, a minimum of 146 cycle parking spaces shall be provided at the site, to include the external cycle parking spaces (26 in total).

Condition : 23 - The development shall be carried out in accordance with the foul and surface water drainage details as approved 05/11/2015 under application reference 00657/B/P27(23,33) (Drainage detail (8567/6002 Rev. E); Below ground floor drainage layout (8567/6001 Rev. C); Public Foul Sewer Outfall Assessment dated June 2015, all received 21/09/2015).
Condition : 24 - The commercial uses hereby approved shall not be open to customers outside the following times: 7:00am to 11:00pm Monday to Saturday, Sundays, Bank Holidays and Public Holidays.
Condition : 25 - No amplified music or other music shall be played outside the commercial premises hereby approved without the prior written consent of the Local Planning Authority.

Condition : 26 - Notwithstanding the provisions of The Town and Country Planning (Use Classes) Order 1987 (as amended) and The Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 (as amended), or any Order revoking or re-enacting these Orders, the commercial uses hereby approved shall not be changed to any other use without further approval in writing from the Local Planning Authority.

Condition : 27 - The development shall be carried out in accordance with the scheme for site decontamination as approved 04/09/2015 under application reference 00657/B/P27(27,29) (Letter from RSK dated 16/04/2015 re: asbestos testing phase 2 area, received 16/04/2015; Letter from St. James dated 10/12/2014 received 16/04/2015; Report on site investigation received 13/07/2015).
Condition : 28 - The non-dwellings at the site shall not be used for a nursery, education establishment or a Place of Worship unless otherwise agreed beforehand by the Local Planning Authority.

Condition : 29 - The development shall be carried out in accordance with the scheme for site remediation as approved 04/09/2015 under application reference 00657/B/P27(27,29) (Letter from RSK dated 16/04/2015 re: asbestos testing phase 2 area, received 16/04/2015; Letter from St. James dated 10/12/2014 received 16/04/2015; Report on site investigation received 13/07/2015).

Condition : 30 - The development shall be carried out in accordance with the details which demonstrate completion of the works set out in the approved site remediation strategy as approved 07/10/2015 under application reference 00657/B/P27(30,31) (Report on site investigation, received 13/07/2015; Letter from St. James dated 10/12/2014, received 03/09/2015; Letter from RSK (Asbestos Testing Phase 2 Area) dated 16/04/2015, received 03/09/2015).

Condition : 31 - Construction site workers shall observe normal hygiene precautions when handling soils. If material suspected of being contaminated is identified during construction, the local planning authority must be notified immediately in writing and this material must be set aside under protective cover. Further tests shall be undertaken to verify the nature and levels of contamination present and details of this and the measures required to dispose of it safely shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority and the methods so approved shall be followed thereafter.

Condition : 32 - If, during development, contamination not previously identified is found to be present at the site then no further development (unless otherwise agreed in writing with the Local Planning Authority) shall be carried out until the developer has submitted, and obtained written approval from the Local Planning Authority for a remediation strategy detailing how this unsuspected contamination shall be dealt with. The remediation strategy shall be implemented as approved.

Condition : 33 - No infiltration of surface water drainage into the ground is permitted other than in accordance with the details as approved 05/11/2015 under application reference 00657/B/P27(23,33) (Drainage detail (8567/6002 Rev. E); Below ground floor drainage layout (8567/6001 Rev. C); Public Foul Sewer Outfall Assessment dated June 2015, all received 21/09/2015).

Condition : 34 - The development shall be carried out in accordance with the foundation design details as approved 08/10/2015 under application reference 00657/B/P27(34) (Drawings: A/001-003 Rev. C, B/001-003 Rev. C, C/001-003 Rev. C & A/091 Rev. B, all received 17/07/2015).

Condition : 35 - The development shall comply in full with the contents of the submitted and approved strategy for the implementation of a programme of archaeological work unless otherwise agreed beforehand in writing by the Local Planning Authority.

Condition : 36 - The development shall be carried out in accordance with the detailed drawings of the proposed boundary treatment to the east of the site (adjacent to the Kew Bridge Steam Museum) as approved 04/11/2015 under application reference 00657/B/P27(36) (Letter from London Museum of Water & Steam dated 09/09/2015, received 16/09/2015; Drawings: OX4748-3 100, 102, 103 & 320 Rev. C02 received 16/09/2015 and OX4748-3 325 Rev. C02 received 02/11/2015).

Condition : 37 - Prior to the first occupation of the dwellings hereby permitted, the local planning authority shall be informed in writing of the agreed naming and numbering of the proposed dwellings so that arrangements can be put in place to ensure that, with the exception of Blue Badge holders, no resident of the development shall obtain a resident's parking permit.
Condition : 38 - The development shall comply in full with the contents of the submitted and approved lift management strategy unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.

Condition : 39 - Prior to the first occupation of the ground-floor dwellings to Buildings B and C (four in total) hereby permitted, details of the boundary treatment to each flat, and any hedging to be enclosed by this (to include maintenance details), shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority. The agreed details shall be implemented as approved prior to the first occupation of these flats. Thereafter the boundary treatments shall only be repaired or replaced, and the hedging shall only be maintained, in accordance with the details agreed by this condition unless otherwise agreed in writing by the local planning authority.
